Text.Value: Lead on, then.
*The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] Holds lantern into the air then stow it <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

Text.Value: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

Text.Value: A prisoner? Then I must be a welcome sight indeed.
An cultist apostate - I reckon one of a kind. Curious.
But don't linger for long. The shadows are not known to take pity.
The cult took me prisoner. Thank the gods you came when you did.
Explain yourself.
Follow me. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.
*You notice a pin on the man's chest, identical to the one you found in Grymforge. He is a Harper.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper lifts lantern into the air. Its glow illuminates his face,
EditorData.logicalname: Player didn't take lantern in combat

Text.Value: The lantern is yours to keep - Jaheira's said as much. It will guide your way to the Towers.
Go on. Take the beast's lantern.
*The pin the man wears is familiar to you. He belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

Text.Value: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Harper] Holds lantern into the air then stow it <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

Text.Value: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.

Text.Value: We've done only as duty dictates.
I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.
You were no prisoner - and I am no fool. Your lies end here, rat.
By the Nine Hells, is that right? Then you are quite the curiosity.

EditorData.logicalname: Player doesn't have lantern - Logic node

Text.Value: A pleasure to keep my weapon stayed for once. Go on, the lantern's yours.

EditorData.logicalname: Came with Harpers hasmet - Avoided combat

Text.Value: No lantern? Damnable cultist. Only a fool would play your bloody games.
Hand over the lantern.
Sorry. I don't have it anymore.
How about I just kill you and keep the lantern for myself?
Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on his kind?
Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on her kind?
Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on their kind?

EditorData.stateContext: Harper points blade at the player.

Text.Value: Your mission is fiction, snake - and Harpers do not ally with liars. We silence them.

EditorData.logicalname: LOGIC - None of them has the lantern

Text.Value: It's time you seize what's yours. Check the drider - take the lantern.
An inn - Last Light, it's called. A place you can sigh without the shadow-beasts hearing.
I'm not here to explain myself - I just want the lantern. Hand it over, or die.
A dangerous choice - but yours to make. I will mark your map.

EditorData.stateContext: Moonlantern is stowed. Neither Harper nor player holding it

Text.Value: And I am no fool.
I will make my way there in my own time.
I'm infected with their parasite, but I'm seeking a cure.
But remember: you don't just fight shadows. You fight what hides inside.
Then I can only apologise. I was not aware of this mission.
My goddess protects me. I'll make my own way there.

EditorData.logicalname: Avatar Shadowheart - Not enemy of Shar

Text.Value: The lantern is yours - Jaheira's orders. Take it, and it will guide your way to the Towers.
Rotten swine!
Jaheira's godsend. Such strange company you keep.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Harper] Draw weapon with his left hand, make stop sign with his right hand <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.

Text.Value: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

Text.Value: Extraordinary. You strike even truer than I'd expected.
Attack him.
Let the lantern's light be your guide. I'll mark your map, should you lose the way.

EditorData.logicalname: Harper marks player's map with Last Light

Text.Value: A tongue of pure silver. Take the lantern from the drider - you've earned it.
Thank you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

Text.Value: I couldn't bear the atrocities committed in the Absolute's name.
Give me the lantern, and follow. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

EditorData.stateContext: Harper no longer points blade at player.

Text.Value: What sort of refuge do you mean?
Lead on, then.
I'm not one of them. They took me prisoner.
I succumbed to their temptations. You gave me an opportunity to escape.

Synopsis: Harper leader after the fight with the Drider. You started the fight on drider's side, but switched and sided with the Harpers. They take the lantern and if you want it, you need to attack them or convince them to give it to you.
